title: National Briefing Washington: Bill For Noncitizen Soldiers
body:
The House Judiciary Committee approved a measure intended to speed the naturalization process for 
noncitizens in the military. 

The bill, which will be presented to the House in coming weeks, would allow immigrant soldiers to apply for 
citizenship after serving one year in the armed forces. The current waiting period is three years. Supporters said the 
legislation would reward immigrant soldiers. Others warned that the bill would not prevent the deportation of the 
soldiers' parents.   Rachel L. Swarns (NYT)
